results.title: Burke's Backyard How to Create a Beaut Backyard
results.brief_description: Features selections from the best of “Burke’s Backyard” segments and looks at the basics of creating your own Shangrila. Designed for the whole family, the video takes the viewer through the tips and hints you need to know to create your own private paradise.

results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Accompanying student text for the audio and video programs in Italian for beginners, “Buongiorno Italia!”. Contains the text of the videos, exercises, reading passages, a key to the exercises, grammar and a glossary.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! [kit]
results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and BBC
results.brief_description: A kit for the Italian for beginners’ course, “Buongiorno Italia!”, containing three 60 minute audio cassettes for pronunciation practice, a copy of “Teachers’ Notes” and a copy of the student text for the course. See also the double video sets, “Buongiorno Italia!” programs 1-10 and 11-20.

results.title: Bullocky
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Richard Mitchell and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Vic Deaves is a fourth generation bushman. For as long as he can remember, his family has lived in and off the Australian bush, often as timber-getters in the coastal valleys of New South Wales. Vic is a bullocky, one of the last of his kind. In this film Vic talks about his life and work, his bullocks and his friends. The area where he works is very much a part of another Australia, now past, but Vic and his surroundings represent the best of it.

results.title: Building for learning
results.brief_description: As the Victorian population increases, the problem of providing school buildings and accomodation becomes more and more accentuated. The purpose of this film is to show the progress being made in this regard, and the problems associated with the building shortage. It also demonstrates the work being done in the various departments of the school and provides a valuable opportunity of showing to children, teachers, parents and other interested adults just what is being done in Victoria to meet the demands of a growing population for the best and the latest in the educational field. Commentary by Max Meldrum, drawings by Betty Jope.

results.title: Bugs Bunny's 1001 rabbit tales
results.creator_credit: Isadore Freleng and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Compilation of classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes cartoons featuring Bugs and Daffy going on the road as two travelling salesmen for Rambling House Publishing Co. Sultan Yosemite Sam is their number one client, and Sam’s royal heir, the Crown Prince of Abadaba, demands constant storytelling, or tantrums ensue. Bugs is held captive reading aloud from the book he is selling. So Bugs retells several children’s classics in his own irreverent style. Voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: Budgeting (NP)
results.brief_description: Shows the essentials of business budgeting, explains how to construct a budget and why it is such an important management tool. Provides clear and colourful graphics with animated sequences. Features John Cleese. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Buddhism: The Path to Enlightenment
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the Buddha from his birth as a prince through time spent as a wandering mendicant in search of a solution for life’s sorrow to his later years when he trudged the dusty paths of India preaching his ego-shattering life-redeeming message. That message is threaded throughout the film as we visit monasteries and families in two different craft communities and see how Buddhism has influenced the lives of these gentle people in southeast Asia.

results.title: Islam
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
Like Christianity, Islam is winning converts, particularly in North Africa. This film explores the faith of the Muslims, taking you to Mecca, birthplace of the Prophet Mohamed, and to the shrine of Islam’s holy of holies, the Ka’aba, or Cube. Following the routes of Muslim conquest, you see shrines of holy men and heroes from Cairo to Pakistan. Wherever you go in this vast empire, the power of Islam is apparent in soaring domes and noble architecture of great cities. Against this background the film relates the history of Mohamed and his rise to leadership, spiritual and temporal. Narrated by Douglas Rain.
